alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:11AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT EASTERN KIT CARSON...NORTHERN WICHITA... WALLACE...LOGAN AND SHERMAN COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM MDT/615 AM CDT/... At 353 AM MDT/453 AM CDT/, the Burlington Airport reported a 51 mph wind gustwith showers along a line extending from near Bethune to 4 miles south of Wallace to 3 miles west of Scott City. Movement was east at 10 mph. Any of these showers will have the potential for sudden wind gusts. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Mesonet. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Burlington and Wallace around 415 AM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 24. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 430 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 179 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
